definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: The name of the eclipsing girl, whatever it was, has not been handed down.
sentences.chinese: 压倒群芳的少女，姓名并未留传下来。

sentences.english: The officer, who refused to give his name, said Fang was on his way to the airport.
sentences.chinese: 该不愿透露姓名的警察表明方滨兴正在赶往机场。

sentences.english: The names of the countries bombing the Japanese-like named countries are very European like.
sentences.chinese: 姓名轰炸的国家，日本类似命名为国家非常欧洲等。

sentences.english: Please write your name and date of birth on this card.
sentences.chinese: 请把您的姓名和出生日写在这张卡上。

sentences.english: If the sender is an individual put address only no name is needed.
sentences.chinese: 如寄信人为个人只需写地址无需写姓名。

sentences.english: Please write your name and address in print.
sentences.chinese: 姓名和地址请用印刷体书写。

sentences.english: The social functions of the name ascertain the essence of the right of name.
sentences.chinese: 姓名的社会功能决定了姓名权的本质。

sentences.english: The social functions of the name ascertain the essence of the right of name.
sentences.chinese: 姓名的社会功能决定了姓名权的本质。

sentences.english: Police did not release the names of the mother and child.
sentences.chinese: 警方没有公布母子俩的姓名。

sentences.english: Names of objects in the standard library, however, are presented in italics.
sentences.chinese: 姓名物体的标准库，然而，在楷体字。

sentences.english: Please write down your name, nationality, and passport number on this registration card.
sentences.chinese: 请把你的姓名，国籍，和护照号写在这张登记卡上。

sentences.english: Enter the contact's name and then select submit.
sentences.chinese: 进入连络人的姓名，然后选择提交。

sentences.english: Review reserved tables and names of such; follow up on special arrangements for pre-assigned tables according to standards.
sentences.chinese: 查抄预定的桌子环境和客人姓名，跟进特别的摆设。

sentences.english: English names are fairly evenly spread between the halves of the alphabet.
sentences.chinese: 英语的姓名在字母表的前后两半部分的分布相当平均。

sentences.english: For example, my mispronunciation of her name could have been a fatal mistake.
sentences.chinese: 举例来说，我念错她的姓名可能是最大的错误。

sentences.english: Names of professions, like the names of people , become intrinsically wound up with identity.
sentences.chinese: 职业的名称，犹如人的姓名，成为身份的固有特征。

definition: one's native place/place of ancestry/registered birthplace
to fill in a form/to write data in a box (on a questionnaire or web form)
